info.title: Zealot API
info.description:
This documentation doesn't provide a way to test our API. In order to facilitate testing, we recommend the following tools:

- [cURL](https://curl.se/) (recommended, command-line)
- [Bruno](https://www.usebruno.com/)
- [Postman](https://www.postman.com/downloads/)
- Your web browser, if you don't need to send headers or a request body

Once you have a working client, you can test that it works by making a GET request to {host}/version:

```json
{
  "version": "5.3.5",
  "vcs_ref": "effe99c25b79fd55d3e1959ea3af0bcb6b75ba1d",
  "build_date": "2024-05-23T06:04:48.989Z"
}
```

## Authentication

This API only accepts one options for authentication: Personal access tokens.
All tokens are tied to a Zealot user and use the `token` query of the request.

Example:

```
https://tryzealot.ews.im/api/users?token={token}
```

### Personal access tokens

Personal access tokens (PATs) can be found in from the [user settings](/docs/user-guide/user_settings).

get.description: Lists all apps, paginated and sorted by created date (newest first)

Allows you to check the Release exists by given query, query accepts two combo group:

- `bundle_id`, `release_version` and `build_verion`
- `bundle_id` and `git_commit`
Query the list of uploaded versions of the single channel and the version list downwards

200.description: Return a build based list of Apps

get.description: Query a list of latest versions of the single channel of the application and reverse the upload date

200.description: Return the latest builds by App ID

post.description: Upload a iOS, Android, macOS, Windows or Linux App

delete.description: Destroy an App all data by ID, include schemes, channel, builds, debug files and the other related resources.

post.summary: Add a collaborator to an App
post.description: Add a collaborator to an App

delete.summary: Remove a collaborator from an App
delete.description: Remove a collaborator from an App

get.description: List debug files by an App's channel key.

200.description: Return a list of debug files

get.description:
Download a single iOS or Android debug file.

To query based on channel_key and release_version as necessary conditions,
without passing the build_version parameter, you can use order to get the first debug
file address that meets the sorting criteria. The sorting methods are:

- `version`: latest version
- `upload_date`: last uploaded date

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort by order / Supported values in version, upload_date

delete.description: Destroy a debug file ID and all data, include dSYM or Proguard files.

post.description:
Upload a dSYM or Proguard file which it was archived with zip formatted whit it accepts:

- `iOS`: a Zipped dSYM file
- `Android`: a Zipped file includes mapping.txt, R.txt or AndroidManifest.xml files.

delete.description: Destroy a scheme from the App

get.description: Get a user metadata, personal data and customize settings

put.description: Update user personalized settings, password, etc.

get.description: Search user by given an email address
Lock a user to stop log in

delete.description: Unlock a user to enable log in

channel_key.description: Channel key, keep it empty to create a new App

file.description: The location of upload App binary file

name.description: the name of App. Use app name from parsed metadata in given file if leave it empty

password.description: visit password, clear it if leave it empty

release_type.description: Release type, for example, debug, beta, adhoc, release, enterprise etc

changelog.description: Change log, accept plain text or JSON formatted data

branch.description: a branch name from source control tool

ci_url.description: the build url of a CI service

custom_fields.description: JSON formatted custom fields, icon only accepts fontawesome.

new_build_callout.description: Whether to send a notification when a new build is available

retained_builds.description: The number of builds to retain for this scheme, set `0` to disable it

slug.description: The slug of Channel, random it if not given

bundle_id.description: identifier valid check, set `*` skip (`bundle_id` for iOS, `package name` for Android)

release_version.description: Release version (requires if Android's Proguard file)

build_version.description: Build version (requires if Android's Proguard file)
